member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.AppliesToProjectAttribute
member.summary: Adds AppliesTo metadata to a MEF export to indicate where this export should be applied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.AppliesToProjectAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:
An expression that indicates where this export should be applied. For example To declare an expression that supports (VisualC or Csharp) AND (MSTest or Nunit) use the following syntax: (VisualC | CSharp) + (MSTest | NUnit)
See the following URLs for expression syntax and supported operations https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.visualstudio.shell.interop.ivsbooleansymbolexpressionevaluator.evaluateexpression.aspx https://github.com/Microsoft/VSProjectSystem/blob/master/doc/overview/about_project_capabilities.md

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.AppliesToProjectAttribute.AppliesTo
member.summary: Gets the expression that indicates where this export should be applied.

member.summary: Attribute to define the default value of an editor option.

member.summary: Default Value of the editor option

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.DefaultOrderings
member.summary: Static class defining some default placeholders for the ordering attributes.

remarks.para: Orderable items that do not explicitly indicate they are before have an implicit constraint that they are after .
Orderable items that do not explicitly indicate they are after have an implicit constraint that they are before .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.DynamicVisibilityAttribute
member.summary: A MEF attribute indicating an attributed object supports dynamic visibility.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ExportImplementationAttribute
member.summary: Along with enables MEF proxy pattern where a single component export serves as a proxy for the best implementation selected at run time. This pattern allows component consumers to just [Import] it, hiding the complexity of selecting one of implementations.

member.summary: Creates new instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IDecorated
member.summary: Represents an object that provides a localized description text and an icon.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IDecorated.Icon
member.summary: Gets the icon representing this object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IDecorated.DescriptionText
member.summary: Gets the localized description of this object. While is the primary representation of this object, the description is not immediately visible and may conveys more detail.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureFlagsAdapter
member.summary: Facilitates access to Visual Studio's IVsFeatureFlags service

remarks.para:
Host specific implementations of this service should be exported as follows:
[ExportImplementation(typeof(IFeatureFlagsAdapter))] [Name("My Feature Flags Adapter")] [Order(Before = "default")] internal sealed class MyFeatureFlagsAdapter : IFeatureFlagsAdapter

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureFlagsAdapter.IsFeatureEnabled(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Queries the Feature Flags service to see whether is enabled.
member.param: Name of feature to check
Default value to use when request can't be made
member.returns: Whether the feature is enabled

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IGuardedOperations.HandleException(System.Object,System.Exception)
member.summary: Handles an exception occured in a call to an extension point.
member.param: Reference to the extension object or event handler that threw the exception
Exception to handle
member.remarks: This class supports the Visual Studio infrastructure and in general is not intended to be used directly from your code. member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.TrackObject``1(``0,System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ILivingObjectDiagnostics{``0})
member.summary: Track object lifecycle in memory. Is free threaded. Called in product code. Does not throw.
member.param: Generic templated object type to track.
Unique identifier for the object being tracked
A static object implementing to help clients of the service to get diagnostics support for the object being tracked/>

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.GetLivingObjects``1
member.summary: Get snapshot of all living object in memory. May require UI thread depending on the object being tracked. Only supposed to be called in Telemetry or Test code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.GetLivingObjects
member.summary: Gets snapshot of all living objects currently. May require UI thread depending on the object being tracked. Only supposed to be called in Telemetry or Test code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.RefreshWeakRefrenceCache
member.summary: Refreshes the cache to get rid of all weak references that are not alive. Usually called before taking a measurement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears the cache of all entries. Not to be called from product code. Used by test code or extensions when they have to start off a clear list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.WasCacheResettedBefore
member.summary: A flag to indicate whether the cache has been resetted before.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IMemoryLeakTrackerService.IsTracking
member.summary: Flag to start or stop the tracking service

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ILivingObjectDiagnostics`1
member.summary: Helper class to check if an object of Type T is considered to be collected or not and to get a quick preview of the object. Implementers of this class are not allowed to have state, otherwise they will cause a leak. Only one static object per type T of the implementation should ever exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ILivingObjectDiagnostics`1.HasProbablyLeaked(`0)
member.summary: This method may require UI thread access depending on the implementation

members.member: This method may require UI thread access depending on the implementation
This method may require UI thread access depending on the implementation

member.summary: Uniquely identifies a part with respect to parts of the same type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IOrderable.After

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IPropertyOwner.Properties
member.summary: The collection of properties controlled by the property owner.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ITelemetryIdProvider`1
member.summary: Represents an object that can provide a unique ID for telemetry purposes. Type of the telemetry ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ITelemetryIdProvider`1.TryGetTelemetryId(`0@)
member.summary: Tries to get a unique ID for telemetry purposes.
member.returns: true if a unique telemetry ID was returned, false if this object refuses to participate in telemetry logging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord`1
member.summary: Generic way to get diagnostic information about living objects of a specific type T

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord`1.#ctor(`0,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to create a record of the living object in memory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord`1.LivingObject
member.summary: The object being leaked. Do not pass to telemetry directly as it may contain PII. Not suitable for telemetry. Used by partners or tests. Please note if the actual object represented by the weak reference should be held for a very short time for test or telemetry purposes only.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord
member.summary: Generic way to get diagnostic information about living objects wihtout a specific type T

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord.HasProbablyLeaked
member.summary: Quick way to tell if the object thats alive is a leak or not. If true and sufficient time for garbage collection is allowed then the object is most likely a memory leak

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord.Identifier
member.summary: Identifier for the current object. May contain PII. Not suitable for telemetry. Used by partners or tests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord.Preview
member.summary: Preview for the object to help diagnose the leak quickly. May contain PII. Not suitable for telemetry. Used by partners or tests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LivingObjectRecord.Description
member.summary: Description of the object being tracked so that can be displayed in human readable format apart from identifier. Usually shorter than a full preview. May contain PII. Not suitable for telemetry. Used by partners or tests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LocalizedNameAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute which can provide a localized name as metadata for a MEF extension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LocalizedNameAttribute.localizedName
member.summary: Note: the localized name is cached rather than the type to prevent MEF from referencing the type in its cache. Types exposed as metadata cause MEF to load the assembly containing the type during composition.

member.summary: Creates an instance of this attribute, which caches the localized name represented by the given type and resource name.
member.param: The type from which to load the localized resource. This should be a type created by the resource designer.
The name of the localized resource string contained the resource type.

The name of the localized resource string contained the resource type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.LocalizedNameAttribute.LocalizedName
member.summary: Gets the localized name specified by the constructor.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFilePathToContentTypeProvider
member.summary: MEF export to map full file names to a content type.

remarks.para:
Instances of this class should define the following MEF attributes.
[Export(typeof(IFilePathToContentTypeProvider)] -- Required [Name("BamBam")] -- Required [Order(After = "Fred", Before="Barney")] -- Optional, can have more than one. [FileExtension(".abc")] -- Optional, but must have either a FileExtension or a FileName attribute. Can optionally be compound extension '.abc.def'. [FileName("George")] -- Optional, but must have either a FileExtension or a FileName attribute [DeferCreation(OptionName = ...)] -- Optional, do not create this extension point unless OptionName is turned on.
You can use "*" as the FileExtension attribute to match any file extension.
The will be called in order (based on the ) if their matches the extension of the file in question (or is a "*") or the matches the name of the file in question.
Compound extensions, such as '.abc.def' are supported via the , however, if there is a mapping for a compound '.abc.def' and a simple extension 'def', the one that is first via wins.

member.returns: true if content type is known for .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureService
member.summary:
Service that keeps track of 's requests to disable a feature in given scope. When multiple s disable a feature and one enables it back, it will not interfere with other disable requests, and feature will ultimately remain disabled.
While this service does have a thread affinity, its implementation does not guarantee thread safety. It is advised to change feature state from UI thread, otherwise simultaneous changes may result in race conditions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureService.IsEnabled(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if feature is enabled. By default, every feature is enabled.
member.param: Name of the feature
member.returns: False if there are any disable requests. True otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureService.Disable(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureController)
member.summary: Disables a feature.
member.param: Name of the feature to disable
Object that uniquely identifies the caller.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureService.StateUpdated
member.summary: Provides a notification when this feature or its base feature was updated. We use FeatureUpdatedEventArgs and not FeatureChangedEventArgs because there are base features and disable requests from parent scopes that affect the factual state of given feature. We use this event to let the interested parties () recalculate the actual state of the feature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureService.GetCookie(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new that provides O(1) access to the feature's value, in this service's scope. The is updated when the feature or its base is updated in this scope or in the global scope.
member.param: Name of the feature
member.returns: New instance of

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFeatureServiceFactory
member.summary:
Service that provides s used to track feature availability and to request feature to be disabled. Feature may be tracked by scope, using and passing e.g. a text view. or throughout the application using .
Features are implemented by exporting and grouped using . Grouping allows alike features to be disabling at once. Grouping also relieves from updating its code when new feature of appropriate category is introduced. Standard editor feature names are available in .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ObjectPool`1
member.summary:
Generic implementation of object pooling pattern with predefined pool size limit. The main purpose is that limited number of frequently used objects can be kept in the pool for further recycling.
Notes: 1) it is not the goal to keep all returned objects. Pool is not meant for storage. If there is no space in the pool, extra returned objects will be dropped.
2) it is implied that if object was obtained from a pool, the caller will return it back in a relatively short time. Keeping checked out objects for long durations is ok, but reduces usefulness of pooling. Just new up your own.
Not returning objects to the pool in not detrimental to the pool's work, but is a bad practice. Rationale: If there is no intent for reusing the object, do not use pool - just use "new".

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.Factory
member.remarks: Not using System.Func{T} because this file is linked into the (debugger) Formatter, which does not have that type (since it compiles against .NET 2.0).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.Allocate
member.summary: Produces an instance.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.Free(`0)
member.summary: Returns objects to the pool.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search in Allocate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.ForgetTrackedObject(`0,`0)
member.summary:
Removes an object from leak tracking.
This is called when an object is returned to the pool. It may also be explicitly called if an object allocated from the pool is intentionally not being returned to the pool. This can be of use with pooled arrays if the consumer wants to return a larger array to the pool than was originally allocated.

member.summary: If someone need to create a private pool
member.param: The size of the pool.

member.summary: Post the event named to the telemetry stream. Additional properties can be appended as name/value pairs in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.ILoggingServiceInternal.PostFault(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and posts a FaultEvent.
member.param: Fault description
Exception instance
Additional information to be added to Watson's ErrorInformation.txt file.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether we sample this event locally. Affects Watson only. If false, will not send to Watson: only sends the telemetry event to AI and doesn't call callback. Changing this will force the event to send to Watson. Be careful because it can have big perf impact. If unchanged, it will be set according to the default sample rate.
TelemetryEventCorrelations which help correlate this fault to the scope it was executing within

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.ILoggingServiceInternal.PostCounters
member.summary: Post all of the counters.

remarks.para: The counters are logged as if PostEvent had been called for each key with a list counter names and values.
The counters are cleared as a side-effect of this call.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.TelemetryResult
member.summary: An enum to define the result from user task or operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.TelemetryResult.None
member.summary: Used for unknown or unavailable result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.TelemetryResult.Success
member.summary: A result without any failure from product or user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.TelemetryResult.Failure
member.summary: A result to indicate the action/operation failed because of product issue (not user faults) Consider using FaultEvent to provide more details about the failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.TelemetryResult.UserFault
member.summary: A result to indicate the action/operation failed because of user fault (e.g., invalid input). Consider using FaultEvent to provide more details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.TelemetryResult.UserCancel
member.summary: A result to indicate the action/operation is cancelled by user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.INonJoinableTaskTrackerInternal
member.summary: Internal tracker for non-joinable tasks. Used to ensure that all pending tasks have completed on editor host shutdown.
member.remarks: Methods of this interface can be called on any thread.
